required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: AG-013736 In Combination With Docetaxel Versus Docetaxel Alone For Patients With Metastatic Breast Cancer
clinical_study.official_title: Randomized, Placebo-Controlled, Double-Blind, Phase 2 Study Of AG-013736 In Combination With Docetaxel Versus Docetaxel Alone In Patients With Metastatic Breast Cancer Preceded By A Phase 1 Evaluation Of The Combination

brief_summary.textblock: The primary purpose of the study is to determine the time to progression of the combination of study drug (AG-013736) and docetaxel versus docetaxel alone in patients who have not received prior chemotherapy for metastatic breast cancer. The secondary purpose of the study is to determine the dose of study drug that can be given with docetaxel administered on an every 3 week schedule.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Phase 2 double-blind baseline until tumor progression or death or discontinuation from study treatment, assessed every 9 weeks up to 129 weeks
primary_outcome.description: Time in days from start of study treatment to first documentation of objective tumor progression or death due to cancer, whichever comes first. TTP was calculated as first event date minus the date of first dose of study medication plus 1. Tumor progression was determined from oncologic assessment data (where data meet the criteria for progressive disease [PD]).

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Objective Response (OR) for Phase 2 (Double-blind)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Phase 2 double- blind baseline until the date of first documented progression or discontinuation from the study treatment due to any cause, assessed every 9 weeks up to 129 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of participants with OR based assessment of confirmed complete response (CR) or confirmed partial response (PR) according to Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors (RECIST). Confirmed responses are those that persist on repeat imaging study at least 4 weeks after initial documentation of response. CR are defined as the disappearance of all lesions (target and/or non target). PR are those with at least 30 percent (%) decrease in the sum of the longest dimensions of the target lesions taking as a reference the baseline sum longest dimensions.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Objective Response (OR) for Phase 2 (Open-label)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Phase 2 open-label baseline until the date of first documented progression or discontinuation from the study due to any cause, assessed every 8 weeks up to 58 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of participants with OR based assessment of confirmed complete response (CR) or confirmed partial response (PR) according to Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors (RECIST). Confirmed responses are those that persist on repeat imaging study at least 4 weeks after initial documentation of response. CR are defined as the disappearance of all lesions (target and/or non target). PR are those with at least 30% decrease in the sum of the longest dimensions of the target lesions taking as a reference the baseline sum longest dimensions.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Phase 2 double-blind baseline until the date of first documented progression or discontinuation from the study due to any cause, assessed every 9 weeks up to 129 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Time in days from the first documentation of objective tumor response to objective tumor progression or death due to any cause. Duration of tumor response was calculated as the date of the first documentation of objective tumor progression or death due to cancer minus the date of the first CR or PR that was subsequently confirmed plus 1. DR was calculated for the subgroup of participants with a confirmed objective tumor response.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Phase 2 open-label baseline until the date of first documented progression or discontinuation from the study due to any cause, assessed every 8 weeks up to 58 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Time in days from the first documentation of objective tumor response to objective tumor progression or death due to any cause. Duration of tumor response was calculated as the date of the first documentation of objective tumor progression or death due to cancer minus the date of the first CR or PR that was subsequently confirmed plus 1. DR was calculated for the subgroup of participants with a confirmed objective tumor response.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Female patients with histologically/cytologically proven metastatic breast carcinoma (stage IV, or recurrent with local or regional spread or distant metastatic disease)
- Adequate bone marrow, liver, and renal function
Exclusion Criteria:
- Adjuvant chemotherapy given in the past 12 months
- Uncontrolled brain metastases

link.description: To obtain contact information for a study center near you, click here.

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Participants who progressed in Docetaxel + Placebo (Phase 2, Double-blind) after consent were eligible to continue to open-label phase. 16 participants crossed-over to open-label phase.

group.title: Axitinib + Docetaxel (Phase-1, Lead-in)
group.description: Axitinib (AG-013736) 5 milligram (mg) tablet orally twice daily (BID) starting from Day 3 of Cycle 1, in cycles of 3 weeks. Docetaxel 80 milligram/square meter (mg/m^2) 1 hour (hr) intravenous (IV) infusion on Day 1 of each cycle, in cycles of 3 weeks.

group.title: Axitinib + Docetaxel (Phase 2, Double-blind)
group.description: Axitinib (AG-013736) 5 mg tablet orally BID starting from Day 1 of Cycle 1, in cycles of 3 weeks. Docetaxel 80 mg/m^2 1 hr IV infusion on Day 1 of each cycle, in cycles of 3 weeks. Treatment was continued until disease progression, intolerable toxicity, or for 2 cycles after complete response.

group.title: Docetaxel + Placebo (Phase 2, Double-blind)
group.description: Placebo matched to axitinib (AG-013736) tablet orally BID starting from Day 1 of Cycle 1, in cycles of 3 weeks. Docetaxel 80 mg/m^2 1 hr IV infusion on Day 1 of each cycle, in cycles of 3 weeks. Treatment was continued until disease progression, intolerable toxicity, or for 2 cycles after complete response. Participants with disease progression after consent were continued to open-label phase.

group.title: Axitinib (Phase 2, Open-label)
group.description: Axitinib (AG-013736) 5 mg tablet orally BID continuously in cycles of 4 weeks.

group.title: Axitinib + Docetaxel (Phase 1, Lead-in)
group.description: Axitinib (AG-013736) 5 mg tablet orally twice daily BID starting from Day 3 of Cycle 1, in cycles of 3 weeks. Docetaxel 80 mg/m^2 1 hr IV infusion on Day 1 of each cycle, in cycles of 3 weeks.

group.title: Axitinib + Docetaxel (Phase 2, Double-blind)
group.description: Axitinib (AG-013736) 5 mg tablet orally BID starting from Day 1 of Cycle 1, in cycles of 3 weeks. Docetaxel 80 mg/m^2 1 hr IV infusion on Day 1 of each cycle, in cycles of 3 weeks. Treatment was continued until disease progression, intolerable toxicity, or for 2 cycles after complete response.

group.title: Docetaxel + Placebo (Double-blind)
group.description: Placebo matched to axitinib (AG-013736) tablet orally BID starting from Day 1 of Cycle 1, in cycles of 3 weeks. Docetaxel 80 mg/m^2 1 hr IV infusion on Day 1 of each cycle, in cycles of 3 weeks. Treatment was continued until disease progression, intolerable toxicity, or for 2 cycles after complete response. Participants with disease progression after consent were continued with axitinib (AG-013736) 5 mg tablet orally BID continuously in cycles of 4 weeks.

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

outcome.title: Time to Tumor Progression (TTP)
outcome.description: Time in days from start of study treatment to first documentation of objective tumor progression or death due to cancer, whichever comes first. TTP was calculated as first event date minus the date of first dose of study medication plus 1. Tumor progression was determined from oncologic assessment data (where data meet the criteria for progressive disease [PD]).
outcome.time_frame: Phase 2 double-blind baseline until tumor progression or death or discontinuation from study treatment, assessed every 9 weeks up to 129 weeks
outcome.population: Study population included all randomized participants who had a baseline assessment of disease and the correct histological cancer type.

group.title: Axitinib + Docetaxel (Phase 2, Double-blind)
group.description: Axitinib (AG-013736) 5 mg tablet orally BID starting from Day 1 of Cycle 1, in cycles of 3 weeks. Docetaxel 80 mg/m^2 1 hr IV infusion on Day 1 of each cycle, in cycles of 3 weeks. Treatment was continued until disease progression, intolerable toxicity, or for 2 cycles after complete response.

group.title: Docetaxel + Placebo (Phase 2, Double-blind)
group.description: Placebo matched to axitinib (AG-013736) tablet orally BID starting from Day 1 of Cycle 1, in cycles of 3 weeks. Docetaxel 80 mg/m^2 1 hr IV infusion on Day 1 of each cycle, in cycles of 3 weeks. Treatment was continued until disease progression, intolerable toxicity, or for 2 cycles after complete response. Participants with disease progression after consent were continued to open-label phase.

measure.title: Time to Tumor Progression (TTP)
measure.description: Time in days from start of study treatment to first documentation of objective tumor progression or death due to cancer, whichever comes first. TTP was calculated as first event date minus the date of first dose of study medication plus 1. Tumor progression was determined from oncologic assessment data (where data meet the criteria for progressive disease [PD]).
measure.population: Study population included all randomized participants who had a baseline assessment of disease and the correct histological cancer type.

analysis.groups_desc: P-value was calculated using one-sided Log rank test, stratified for estrogen receptor (ER) status (ER-positive or ER-negative/unknown), prior adjuvant chemotherapy (yes or no), and Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group (ECOG) performance status (less than or equal to [=<1] or 2). The stratified Cox proportional hazards model was fitted, using the same stratification variables as above.
analysis.method_desc: One-sided log-rank test at alpha = 0.1 significance level was used.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With Objective Response (OR) for Phase 2 (Double-blind)
outcome.description: Percentage of participants with OR based assessment of confirmed complete response (CR) or confirmed partial response (PR) according to Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors (RECIST). Confirmed responses are those that persist on repeat imaging study at least 4 weeks after initial documentation of response. CR are defined as the disappearance of all lesions (target and/or non target). PR are those with at least 30 percent (%) decrease in the sum of the longest dimensions of the target lesions taking as a reference the baseline sum longest dimensions.
outcome.time_frame: Phase 2 double- blind baseline until the date of first documented progression or discontinuation from the study treatment due to any cause, assessed every 9 weeks up to 129 weeks
outcome.population: Study population included all randomized participants who had a baseline assessment of disease and the correct histological cancer type.

group.title: Axitinib + Docetaxel (Phase 2, Double-blind)
group.description: Axitinib (AG-013736) 5 mg tablet orally BID starting from Day 1 of Cycle 1, in cycles of 3 weeks. Docetaxel 80 mg/m^2 1 hr IV infusion on Day 1 of each cycle, in cycles of 3 weeks. Treatment was continued until disease progression, intolerable toxicity, or for 2 cycles after complete response.

group.title: Docetaxel + Placebo (Phase 2, Double-blind)
group.description: Placebo matched to axitinib (AG-013736) tablet orally BID starting from Day 1 of Cycle 1, in cycles of 3 weeks. Docetaxel 80 mg/m^2 1 hr IV infusion on Day 1 of each cycle, in cycles of 3 weeks. Treatment was continued until disease progression, intolerable toxicity, or for 2 cycles after complete response. Participants with disease progression after consent were continued to open-label phase.

measure.title: Percentage of Participants With Objective Response (OR) for Phase 2 (Double-blind)
measure.description: Percentage of participants with OR based assessment of confirmed complete response (CR) or confirmed partial response (PR) according to Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors (RECIST). Confirmed responses are those that persist on repeat imaging study at least 4 weeks after initial documentation of response. CR are defined as the disappearance of all lesions (target and/or non target). PR are those with at least 30 percent (%) decrease in the sum of the longest dimensions of the target lesions taking as a reference the baseline sum longest dimensions.
measure.population: Study population included all randomized participants who had a baseline assessment of disease and the correct histological cancer type.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With Objective Response (OR) for Phase 2 (Open-label)
outcome.description: Percentage of participants with OR based assessment of confirmed complete response (CR) or confirmed partial response (PR) according to Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors (RECIST). Confirmed responses are those that persist on repeat imaging study at least 4 weeks after initial documentation of response. CR are defined as the disappearance of all lesions (target and/or non target). PR are those with at least 30% decrease in the sum of the longest dimensions of the target lesions taking as a reference the baseline sum longest dimensions.
outcome.time_frame: Phase 2 open-label baseline until the date of first documented progression or discontinuation from the study due to any cause, assessed every 8 weeks up to 58 weeks
outcome.population: All treated (AT) population included participants from Phase 2 who progressed by RECIST criteria while in the placebo + docetaxel treatment group and had a baseline disease assessment and received at least 1 dose of study medication.

group.title: Axitinib (Phase 2, Open-label)
group.description: Axitinib (AG-013736) 5 mg tablet orally BID continuously in cycles of 4 weeks.

measure.title: Percentage of Participants With Objective Response (OR) for Phase 2 (Open-label)
measure.description: Percentage of participants with OR based assessment of confirmed complete response (CR) or confirmed partial response (PR) according to Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors (RECIST). Confirmed responses are those that persist on repeat imaging study at least 4 weeks after initial documentation of response. CR are defined as the disappearance of all lesions (target and/or non target). PR are those with at least 30% decrease in the sum of the longest dimensions of the target lesions taking as a reference the baseline sum longest dimensions.
measure.population: All treated (AT) population included participants from Phase 2 who progressed by RECIST criteria while in the placebo + docetaxel treatment group and had a baseline disease assessment and received at least 1 dose of study medication.

outcome.title: Duration of Response (DR) for Phase 2 (Double-blind)
outcome.description: Time in days from the first documentation of objective tumor response to objective tumor progression or death due to any cause. Duration of tumor response was calculated as the date of the first documentation of objective tumor progression or death due to cancer minus the date of the first CR or PR that was subsequently confirmed plus 1. DR was calculated for the subgroup of participants with a confirmed objective tumor response.
outcome.time_frame: Phase 2 double-blind baseline until the date of first documented progression or discontinuation from the study due to any cause, assessed every 9 weeks up to 129 weeks
outcome.population: Subgroup of participants from the study population with a confirmed objective tumor response (CR or PR).

group.title: Axitinib + Docetaxel (Phase 2, Double-blind)
group.description: Axitinib (AG-013736) 5 mg tablet orally BID starting from Day 1 of Cycle 1, in cycles of 3 weeks. Docetaxel 80 mg/m^2 1 hr IV infusion on Day 1 of each cycle, in cycles of 3 weeks. Treatment was continued until disease progression, intolerable toxicity, or for 2 cycles after complete response.

group.title: Docetaxel + Placebo (Phase 2, Double-blind)
group.description: Placebo matched to axitinib (AG-013736) tablet orally BID starting from Day 1 of Cycle 1, in cycles of 3 weeks. Docetaxel 80 mg/m^2 1 hr IV infusion on Day 1 of each cycle, in cycles of 3 weeks. Treatment was continued until disease progression, intolerable toxicity, or for 2 cycles after complete response. Participants with disease progression after consent were continued to open-label phase.

measure.title: Duration of Response (DR) for Phase 2 (Double-blind)
measure.description: Time in days from the first documentation of objective tumor response to objective tumor progression or death due to any cause. Duration of tumor response was calculated as the date of the first documentation of objective tumor progression or death due to cancer minus the date of the first CR or PR that was subsequently confirmed plus 1. DR was calculated for the subgroup of participants with a confirmed objective tumor response.
measure.population: Subgroup of participants from the study population with a confirmed objective tumor response (CR or PR).

outcome.description: Time in days from the first documentation of objective tumor response to objective tumor progression or death due to any cause. Duration of tumor response was calculated as the date of the first documentation of objective tumor progression or death due to cancer minus the date of the first CR or PR that was subsequently confirmed plus 1. DR was calculated for the subgroup of participants with a confirmed objective tumor response.
outcome.time_frame: Phase 2 open-label baseline until the date of first documented progression or discontinuation from the study due to any cause, assessed every 8 weeks up to 58 weeks
outcome.population: Subgroup of participants from the AT population with a confirmed objective tumor response (CR or PR).

group.title: Axitinib (Phase 2, Open-label)
group.description: Axitinib (AG-013736) 5 mg tablet orally BID continuously in cycles of 4 weeks.

measure.title: Duration of Response (DR) for Phase 2 (Open-label)
measure.description: Time in days from the first documentation of objective tumor response to objective tumor progression or death due to any cause. Duration of tumor response was calculated as the date of the first documentation of objective tumor progression or death due to cancer minus the date of the first CR or PR that was subsequently confirmed plus 1. DR was calculated for the subgroup of participants with a confirmed objective tumor response.
measure.population: Subgroup of participants from the AT population with a confirmed objective tumor response (CR or PR).

measurement_list.measurement: 95% confidence interval was not estimable since there was only 1 responder. Hence variability could not be estimated.

outcome.title: Population Pharmacokinetics of Axitinib (AG-013736) for Phase 2 (Double-blind)
outcome.description: Data for this Outcome Measure are not reported here because the analysis population includes participants who were not enrolled in this study. ClinicalTrials.gov is designed for reporting results from only those participants who were enrolled in the study and described in the Participant Flow and Baseline Characteristics modules.
outcome.time_frame: Day 1 (pre-dose), Day 22 and Day 43 and then every 9 weeks up to 129 weeks

reported_events.desc: The same event may appear as both an AE and a SAE. However, what is presented are distinct events. An event may be categorized as serious in one subject and as nonserious in another subject, or one subject may have experienced both a serious and nonserious event during the study.

group.title: Axitinib + Docetaxel (Phase-1 Lead-in)
group.description: Axitinib (AG-013736) 5 mg tablet orally BID starting from Day 3 of Cycle 1, in cycles of 3 weeks. Docetaxel 80 mg/m^2 1 hr IV infusion on Day 1 of each cycle, in cycles of 3 weeks.

group.title: Axitinib + Docetaxel (Phase 2, Double-blind)
group.description: Axitinib (AG-013736) 5 mg tablet orally BID starting from Day 1 of Cycle 1, in cycles of 3 weeks. Docetaxel 80 mg/m^2 1 hr IV infusion on Day 1 of each cycle, in cycles of 3 weeks. Treatment was continued until disease progression, intolerable toxicity, or for 2 cycles after complete response.

group.title: Docetaxel + Placebo (Phase 2, Double-blind)
group.description: Placebo matched to axitinib (AG-013736) tablet orally BID starting from Day 1 of Cycle 1, in cycles of 3 weeks. Docetaxel 80 mg/m^2 1 hr IV infusion on Day 1 of each cycle, in cycles of 3 weeks. Treatment was continued until disease progression, intolerable toxicity, or for 2 cycles after complete response. Participants with disease progression after consent were continued to open-label phase.

group.title: Axitinib (Phase 2, Open-label)
group.description: Axitinib (AG-013736) 5 mg tablet orally BID continuously in cycles of 4 weeks.

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Pfizer has the right to review disclosures, requesting a delay of less than 60 days. Investigator will postpone single center publications until after disclosure of pooled data (all sites), less than 12 months from study completion/termination at all participating sites. Investigator may not disclose previously undisclosed confidential information other than study results.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: Analysis of TTP (Phase 2, Double-blind) was performed with both discontinuation due to lack of efficacy (LOE) considered a progression and not considered a progression event. Latter was considered primary analysis and former a sensitivity analysis.
